slides.title: Keeping communities safer, together.
text: Take a photo or video of a power pole, power line or other electrical equipment
that seems hazardous. Use this app to send it straight to our Safety Team.

slides.title: Report Non-Emergencies faster.
text: If you smell natural gas, see downed or sparking power lines or witness any other
emergency be sure to call 911. If you need to report an outage call 1-800-PGE-5000.

slides.title: How it works
text: Send us photos or videos of the safety concern. We'll send you updates until the issue
is closed. This app is not meant for emergencies: if you smell natural gas or see a
downed or sparking power line, leave the area immediately and call 911.

slides.title: View reported concerns nearby.
text: You're also able to view details of reported concerns in your area. You can start your own
report and stay current on when it will be resolved.

content.name: header
text: Keeping communities safer, together.

content.name: paragraph1
text: While our new app is in the preview stage, only those who
received an invitation can report a safety concern.
By reporting a concern, you agree that PG&E will keep a record
of your concern for any follow up. PG&E will keep your identity and
email address confidential.
Please enter the email address where your invite was sent:
note: test@test.com is valid, all others fail

content.name: header1
text:
We couldn't find
your email.

content.name: paragraph1
text: We're sorry, the app is not available for [email address]. Only invitees
may use the app at this preview stage.
Received an invite? Please use the email address where your invite was sent.
If you didn't receive an invite, please join our waitlist. We'll notify you when
there's a opening for the app.

content.name: header1
text:
Thank you for joining
our waitlist! We'll

contact you when
we have an opening.

content.name: emergency-header
text: Is this an emergency?

content.name: emergency-subheader1
text:
Leave the area immediately
and call 911 if you:

content.name: emergency-condition1
text: Smell natural gas

content.name: emergency-condition2
text: See downed or sparking power lines

content.name: emergency-subheader2
text:
Use the app to report non-emergency
electrical hazards.

content.name: header
text: How it works

content.name: header1
text: STEP 01

content.name: paragraph1
text: Tell us where the safety concern is located.

content.name: header2
text: STEP 02

content.name: paragraph2
text: Submit photos or videos of the safety concern, plus a brief description.

content.name: header3
text: STEP 03

content.name: paragraph3
text: We'll send you a confirmation and follow-up emails until the issue is closed.

content.name: paragraph1
text: Take a photo or video of a power pole, power line or other electrical equipment that seems hazardous.
Use this app to send it straight to our Safety Team.

content.name: paragraph2
text: If you smell natural gas, see downed or sparking power lines or witness any other emergency be sure to
call 911. If you need to report an outage call 1-800-PGE-5000.

content.name: paragraph3
text: Send us photos or videos of the safety concern. We'll send you updates until the issue is closed. This app
is not meant for emergencies: if you smell natural gas or see a downed or sparking power line, leave the
area immediately and call 911.

content.name: paragraph4
text: You're also able to view details of reported concerns in your area. You can start your own report and stay
current on when it will be resolved.

content.name: paragraph1
text: PG&E collects certain personal information about you in order to provide products and services to you.
We also share information about your use of our mobile app with our analytics partners. PG&E does not
sell your personal information for any monetary value. Under California law, collection of data through
third-party cookies for targeted advertising and similar purposes may be considered a 'sale.' When
you use our mobile app, we store cookies on your app to collect information. The information collected
might relate to you, your preferences or your device, and is mostly used to make the mobile app work as
you expect it to and to provide a more personalized experience. However, you can choose to opt out of
the sale of your personal information and not to allow certain types of cookies, which may impact
your experience of the app and the services we are able to offer. Review the categories below to find
out more and change our default settings according to your preference. To opt-out of cookies, move
the toggle switch to the left so that it shows as gray. You cannot opt-out of our First Party Strictly
Necessary Cookies as they are deployed in order to ensure the proper functioning of our app.

content.name: paragraph2
text: These cookies are necessary for the mobile app to function and cannot be switched off in our systems.
They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services,
such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. These cookies do not store
any personally identifiable information.

content.name: paragraph3
text: These cookies allow us to count visits so we can measure and improve the performance of our site.
They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around
the app.    All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you
do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have used our app and will not be able to
monitor its performance.
